register.description: This register contains the IP revision code for the SCRM.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Revision Number

register.description: This register holds the clock setup time counters of the system clock source supplier.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Holds the number of 32 kHz clock cycles it takes to gate the clock source supplier.
Reads returns 0.
Holds the number of 32 kHz clock cycles it takes to stabilize the clock source supplier.

register.description: This register holds the setup time counters for the sleep mode of the clock-source generator power supply (the power supply in external connected PMIC or LDO).

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Holds the number of 32 kHz clock cycles it takes to exit the clock-source generator power supply from sleep mode. SCRM starts Wakeup-time counter by activation of power request.
Reads returns 0.
Holds the number of 32 kHz clock cycles it takes to enter the clock source generator power supply in sleep mode. SCRM activates Sleep-time counter by deactivation of power request.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the external clock request.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit defines the active level of the external clock request.

bitenum.description: The external clock request is active low.
The external clock request is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the accurate clock request.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit defines the active level of the accurate clock request.

bitenum.description: The accurate clock request is active low.
The accurate clock request is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the external power request.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit defines the active level of the external power request.

bitenum.description: The external power request is active low.
The external power request is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the auxiliary clock request #0.

bitfield.description: This field allows re-mapping the auxiliary clock request #0 on another auxiliary clock output than auxiliary clock #0.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #0 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #0.
The auxiliary clock request #0 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #1.
The auxiliary clock request #0 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #2.
The auxiliary clock request #0 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #3.

bitfield.description: This bit qualifies the auxiliary clock request #0 as an accurate clock request.

bitenum.description: An active auxiliary clock request #0 doesn't generate an accurate clock request.
An active auxiliary clock request #0 generates an accurate clock request.

bitfield.description: This bit defines the active level of the auxiliary clock request #0.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #0 is active low.
The auxiliary clock request #0 is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the auxiliary clock request #1.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This field allows re-mapping the auxiliary clock request #1 on another auxiliary clock output than auxiliary clock #1.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #1 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #0.
The auxiliary clock request #1 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #1.
The auxiliary clock request #1 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #2.
The auxiliary clock request #1 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #3.

bitfield.description: This bit qualifies the auxiliary clock request #1 as an accurate clock request.

bitenum.description: An active auxiliary clock request #1 doesn't generate an accurate clock request.
An active auxiliary clock request #1 generates an accurate clock request.

bitfield.description: This bit defines the active level of the auxiliary clock request #1.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #1 is active low.
The auxiliary clock request #1 is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the auxiliary clock request #2.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This field allows re-mapping the auxiliary clock request #2 on another auxiliary clock output than auxiliary clock #2.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #2 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #0.
The auxiliary clock request #2 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #1.
The auxiliary clock request #2 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #2.
The auxiliary clock request #2 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #3.

bitfield.description: This bit qualifies the auxiliary clock request #2 as an accurate clock request.

bitenum.description: An active auxiliary clock request #2 doesn't generate an accurate clock request.
An active auxiliary clock request #2 generates an accurate clock request.

bitfield.description: This bit defines the active level of the auxiliary clock request #2.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #2 is active low.
The auxiliary clock request #2 is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the auxiliary clock request #3.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This field allows re-mapping the auxiliary clock request #3 on another auxiliary clock output than auxiliary clock #3.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #3 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #0.
The auxiliary clock request #3 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #1.
The auxiliary clock request #3 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #2.
The auxiliary clock request #3 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #3.

bitfield.description: This bit qualifies the auxiliary clock request #3 as an accurate clock request.

bitenum.description: An active auxiliary clock request #3 doesn't generate an accurate clock request.
An active auxiliary clock request #3 generates an accurate clock request.

bitfield.description: This bit defines the active level of the auxiliary clock request #3.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #3 is active low.
The auxiliary clock request #3 is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the auxiliary clock request #4.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This field allows re-mapping the auxiliary clock request #4 on another auxiliary clock output than auxiliary clock #4.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #4 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #0.
The auxiliary clock request #4 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #1.
The auxiliary clock request #4 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #2.
The auxiliary clock request #4 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #3.
The auxiliary clock request #4 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #4.
The auxiliary clock request #4 is mapped on the auxiliary clock #5.

bitfield.description: This bit qualifies the auxiliary clock request #4 as an accurate clock request.

bitenum.description: An active auxiliary clock request #4 doesn't generate an accurate clock request.
An active auxiliary clock request #4 generates an accurate clock request.

bitfield.description: This bit defines the active level of the auxiliary clock request #4.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock request #4 is active low.
The auxiliary clock request #4 is active high.

register.description: This register holds qualifiers for the auxiliary clock #0.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This field holds the divider value for the auxiliary clock #0.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 1.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 2.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 3.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 4.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 5.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 6.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 7.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 8.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 9.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 10.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 11.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 12.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 13.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 14.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 15.
The auxiliary clock #0 is divided by 16.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit allows to gate the auxiliary clock #0 without condition. This is bit is intended to be used only when the SOC is not clock provider.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock #0 is gated upon normal condition: auxiliary clock requests mapped on this path or ENABLE bit set.
The auxiliary clock #0 is gated wihout conditon.

bitfield.description: This bit allows to request the auxiliary clock #0 by software.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock #0 is not requested by software.
The auxiliary clock #0 is requested by software.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This field allows selecting the clock source of the auxiliary clock #0.

bitenum.description: The clock source is the system clock (SYS_CLK).
The clock source is the version from the DPLL_CORE.
The clock source is the version from the DPLL_PER.

bitfield.description: This bit defines the output level when the auxiliary clock #0 is gated.

bitenum.description: The auxiliary clock #0 is gated low.
The auxiliary clock #0 is gated high.

register.description: This register holds the reset time counter which is used to extend the reset lines beyond the release of the pad reset.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
Holds the number of 32 kHz clock cycles for which the reset duration is extended. Values 0,1 and 2 are not allowed. 0x0: Reserved. 0x1: Reserved. 0x2: Reserved.

register.description: This register allows the software to perform an external power-on reset.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit controls the assertion and the de-assertion of the external power-on reset.

bitenum.description: De-asserts the external power-on reset.
Asserts the external power-on reset.

bitfield.description: This bit must be set to 1 to allow the software to assert the external power-on reset.

bitenum.description: Prevents the software to assert the external power-on reset.
Allows the software to assert the external power-on reset.

register.description: This register logs the source of warm reset output. Each bit is set upon release of the warm reset output and must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit logs the external warm reset source.

bitenum.description: No external warm reset occurred.
An external warm reset occurred.

register.description: This register logs the source of warm reset on the APE. Each bit is set upon release of the APE warm reset and must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
This bit logs the APE warm reset source.

bitenum.description: No APE warm reset occurred.
An APE warm reset occurred.

bitfield.description: Reads returns 0.
